justification: "To measure antisocial behavior, we developed a measure titled ASB-ES which contains 27 items…"
The article critiques "other scales (e.g., crime and analogous behavior; CAB…)" as prior instruments used to operationalize antisocial behavior.
It notes that "others (e.g., the subtypes of antisocial behavior; STAB; Burt & Donellan, 2009) include affective and comparative content," identifying STAB as another antisocial-behavior scale.
"The HEXACO-60 (Ashton & Lee, 2009) was used to measure the HEXACO personality traits. Each of the six traits is measured by 10 items."
"The Triarchic Psychopathy Measure (TriPM) was developed… to measure three constructs of psychopathy: boldness (19 items)…"
The same sentence lists "meanness (19 items)" as one of the constructs the TriPM measures.
The TriPM description also specifies it measures "disinhibition (20 items)."
"Aluja, Kuhlman, and Zuckerman (2010) created the 200-item ZKA-PQ measure of the five factors… in the AFFM: extraversion, neuroticism, sensation seeking, aggressiveness and activity."
construct: AFFM personality factors (Neuroticism, Extraversion, Activity, Aggressiveness, Sensation Seeking)

measured_by: Financial framing decision tasks (20-item / 60-item risky-choice tasks)
justification: "Risky decision making was measured using 20 financial decision tasks…" (study 1) and "Risky decision making was measured using 60 decision-making tasks…" (study 2).
